main event: White flashes of light were seen, and radar picked up 25 targets in a 2-3 minute period, with the objects estimated to be 25-30 miles from the aircraft. No interception was attempted.
interesting points: The objects were detected by both visual observation and radar.
The objects were estimated to be traveling at speeds between 225-250 knots.
The radar tracked the objects for about 10 minutes, with the objects moving in a straight line or split straight flashing beacon pattern.
The objects were observed from 30 degrees northeast to 30 degrees northwest of the aircraft.
The report was signed by 6 members of the crew, including 2 technical personnel, 1 bombardier-navigator, 1 co-pilot, 1 captain, and 1 major, all of the USAF.
sighted object: White flashes of light and unidentified radar targets
location: Coast, approximately 100 miles southwest of New Orleans, Gulf of Mexico
